titles.title: New York Canal National Heritage Corridor Act of 1998
To establish the New York Canal National Heritage Corridor as an affiliated unit of the National Park System, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 8/6/1998--Introduced. New York Canal National Heritage Corridor Act of 1998 - Establishes the New York Canal National Heritage Corridor as an affiliated unit of the National Park System, whose boundaries shall include the counties that are located along the New York Canal Corridor and connecting waterways. Authorizes the Secretaries of the Interior, of Housing and Urban Development, of Agriculture, and of Transportation, and the heads of other appropriate Federal agencies, upon the request of local governments within the Heritage Corridor, to give financial assistance to implement Corridor activities through any program under which such local governments may be assisted. Provides that nothing in this Act shall be construed as a restriction on land use, development, or any other local or individual action.
